fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-530].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
JIRA Portfolio does not display Scheduling information

h3. Environment
This issue can be replicated with JIRA Portfolio 1.10.5 on a compatible version of JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
This issue can be replicated following the steps below: 
# Filter against a single release, team, theme or stage
# Delete the filtered release, team, theme or stage
# Recalculate the Plan. 

h3. Expected Results
Scheduling should be displayed

h3. Actual Results
No scheduling result is shown. Instead a message saying "The current result set does not contain any initiatives/epics/stories."

h3. Notes
This appears to be the same as the issue identified in: [The current scheduling result does not contain any initiatives in JIRA Portfolio - Atlassian Answers - Atlassian Answers|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/10390163/getting-the-current-scheduling-result-does-not-contain-any-initiatives.-in-jira-portfolio

h3. Workaround
# Enable ALL the Filters (using the checkboxes)
# Disable ALL the Filters (by deselecting all items)
# The Scheduling should now be shown as expected.
fields.summary: No scheduling result when filtering on a deleted criteria
Error when performing "Update from date" on a blank plan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-523].
  {panel}

It looks like the "text" of the issue link isn't updated when issues are moved between projects. If you import an issue and move it to a different project, the text of the issue link shows the old id (which no longer exists). The link still points to the issue correctly. 

I'm not sure if this has any other consequences (i.e when pushing updates from Portfolio), but I haven't observed any as yet.

*Steps to Reproduce*
# Create an issue under one project
# Import into Portfolio
# Move issue to another project

* Workaround* 
# Remove the Issue and re-import

*Expected Behavior*
# Issue link should be updated when loading the plan post issue move.
fields.summary: Issue Link not updated after move between projects.
Make it easier to assign parent Initiatives and Epics when importing issues.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-521].
  {panel}

Dear Martin Suntinger,

You may recall that we - briefly - exhanged ideas/opinions earlier this month on the subject of JIRA Portfolio.

Our evaluation has now been completed and our project manager, Gert Pedersen, has submitted his report to our Confluence "Wiki" instance - pls. see the attached PDF.

As you will note, the recommendation, and the following decision, was not to license JPO at the moment.

I'm sending you the evaluation report to ensure that you know exactly what triggered the outcome. I trust you can use the content, not just to dismiss our quaint ways of working ;-), but also for improving the product going forward.

If you have any questions, please comment on this ticket.

In any case, I'll be attending the Summit next November, should the need arise for us to have further interaction.

Cheers,

Lasse
fields.summary: JIRA Portfolio Evaluation - Pls. forward to Martin Suntinger

  {panel}

In the list of issues in JIRA Portfolio, I can manually assign possible team members to a task by checking the check mark next to their name.
See this screenshot from your documentation:
!https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/files/715262710/Assign+Teammembers.png!

In JIRA we already use a custom field with multiple users that we call "Assignee options". We fill that field with the users that are able to take on the issue. We use that field to create Todo lists etc. on people's dashboards.

I would like the contents of such a field to be used for "manually" selecting possible assignees in Portfolio.

Let me know if my request is not clear or if I need to explain it further.

fields.description:
h4. Summary
Possible performance problem showing in the Portfolio Menu dropdwon.

h4. Steps to reproduce
Click on Portfolio menu button

h4. Expected Result
Drop down menu listing the recent plans will be shown

h4. Actual Result 
In some cases the loading of the recent plans could be very slow, as a result the dropdown seems not to open on click. Seems like it's due to a lot of permissions configured for plans.

h4. Workaround
create the relevant index for the table AOPERMISSION via the following SQL script
{code:sql}
CREATE INDEX `idx_AO_A415DF_AOPERMISSION_TARGET_ID`  ON `jira`.`AO_A415DF_AOPERMISSION` (TARGET_ID)
{code}
fields.summary: Possible performance problem showing Portfolio Menu dropdown

fields.description:
Setup: As per the attached JIRA Potfolio plan.

There are two epics, both without stories.  Epic 1 is 9 days.  Epic 2 is 15 days.  There are 2 developers.  Sprints have 20 days of developer effort available.  The Minimum Load is configured to be 5 days.  My expectations re: scheduling are:
# Epic 1 gets allocated to Developer 1 and completes in Sprint 1.
# Epic 2 has 10 of its days allocated to Developer 2 in Sprint 2.
# Because of the Minimum Load setting of 5 days, the 5 remaining days of work on Epic 2 will not be divided into a smaller chunk, and will thus get allocated to Developer 1 in Sprint 2.  This is based on my understanding is that a chunk of work is not brought into a sprint that already has work in it unless that chunk of work will complete within the sprint.

What actually happens is that 1 of the days of work on Epic 2 is allocated to Developer 1.  The remaining 4 days of work on Epic 2 are allocated to Developer 1 in Sprint 2.  This can be seen clearly in the Capacity by Member view.

Based on the description of Minimum Load on the Configuration page, this does not seem correct to me.  Here is a copy-and-paste of the description:

Defines the minimum work package size for epics without stories. This setting prevents free capacities from being filled up with unrealistically small work packages, which would not exist once an epic is broken down into stories. Set this to the estimate of a typical small story to schedule epics as realistically as possible, or set this to 0 to intentionally maximize capacity filling and break down epics into the smallest possible units.
fields.summary: Minimum Load scheduling option doesn't seem to work
Documentation: screenshot missing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-503].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 24 March 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting! This issue is being addressed as part of the all new Portfolio live plans, which feature an entirely overhauled and more seamless integration model with JIRA Software / Agile. Live plans are currently available as a labs feature for both Server* and Cloud, so you can start evaluating them without any risk of impacting existing Portfolio plans. They are not yet feature-complete, we're working on bringing all major capabilities of standard plans back into live plans on top of the new integration model before we graduate live plans out of labs and make them the new standard way of working. 
Please check out this blog for a summary and short videos of how the top-voted suggestions are being addressed with live plans: [Top 10 suggestions addressed in live plans|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2016/03/10-user-suggestions-addressed-in-portfolio-for-jira/] and join our [Portfolio Pioneers LinkedIn group|https://www.linkedin.com/groups/7018171] to discuss feedback and best practices!
 
Thanks,
Martin Suntinger
[msuntinger@atlassian.com|mailto:msuntinger@atlassian.com]
Principal Product Manager, Portfolio for JIRA
 
^*The live plans labs feature is available with Portfolio for JIRA 1.12 or higher. It is compatible with JIRA Software 7.0.5 or higher, and JIRA 6.3 or higher, in association with JIRA Agile 6.7.12 or higher.^
{panel}

As it is now, changes in Epic Links are not synchronized between the JIRA issues and epics and Portfolio Epics and Stories.
When portfolio stories and their epics are linked to JIRA issues and epics, then the epic link relations should_ always be consistent_ between JIRA and portfolio.

* When I change the epic link of a JIRA issue in JIRA, this should be reflected in the hierarchy in Portfolio
* When I move a story to an Epic in Portfolio, this should be reflected in the Epic link in the JIRA issue.

Ideally, the synchronization would be automatic and instant.
However, being able to update the links using the manually activated "update" functionality could be an acceptable workaround.

In my opinion, this missing consistency is by far the most important missing piece of "JIRA Agile integration." and deserves individual attention.
We are evaluating Portfolio right now and I can vividly imagine the nightmare it would be to keep the epic links in JIRA and Portfolio consistent by manually checking and fixing them every day.
fields.summary: Epic link should be synchronized between JIRA and Portfolio

fields.description:
We have a scenario that regularly occurs here in our workflow with JIRA portfolio.

Something to know: 1 day here is equal to 7.5 hours. In JIRA portfolio we show the estimate based on days.

An example:
# A developer creates a JIRA ticket and estimates this, f.e. 2h
# The story is imported in JIRA Portfolio
# We update the plan on a daily basis as the developer fill in worklogs on a daily basis

However, when we import the story in JIRA portfolio that already has an estimate of 2 hours, the estimate shown for that story in JIRA portfolio will be 0.3 days, while when clicking on the progress we do see 0.26666... days.

All this is not so problematic, BUT, when we update the plan, JIRA Portfolio wants to update the remaining estimate in the linked JIRA ticket, while no work was done for that ticket yet. Developers then get a notification that f.e. 15 minutes were added to the original estimate of the ticket.
The plan update thinks 15 minutes were spent, and augments the original estimate with 15 minutes.
fields.summary: Importing a story with estimates doesn't take over the exact estimate in portfolio

fields.description:
When assigning JIRA users to a JIRA Portfolio 'Team', it's possible to also select inactivated users.

In our case we had two persons with the same name, one inactive and one active, and the user picker list shows both (without showing the account name, you only see the first and last name).

In the 'Permissions' list, the same happens: all inactive users still can be chosen here as well, even though they're not even in the 'jira-users' group. Here you do see the account name next to the first and last name.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-489].
  {panel}

While using the filter search ability on the "Import Existing Issues" screen, if you start the search with a question mark (standard search wildcard for "any one character"), the search crashes.

h2. Repro Steps:
1. On a JIRA system with JIRA Portfolio installed, launch Portfolio and open/create a Plan.
2. From the Backlog screen, use the "Import Issues" button to open the "Import Existing Issues" screen
3. In the filter select dropdown, type in a question mark (?).

h2. Result: 
An error message appears suggesting the system has crashed (it has not, but most users would take this message to mean it had)

h2. Expected Result:
No error should occur or at least the error message should be more like the equivalent warning in the JIRA Issue Navigator that explains that characters is a reserved character and can't be used at the beginning of the word.
fields.summary: The "Import Existing Issue" select filter crashes if you start the search with "?" as the first letter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-487].
  {panel}

We have a situation where the same team is split between multiple projects. Right now the only ways to represent the team in JPO are either splitting the team manually (which interferes with automatic scheduling) or creating a kitchen sink plan (which is a problem because of JPO-159 and is an antipattern in itself, since it becomes unwieldy).

It would be great if teams were a cross-plan entity and planning was a cross-plan activity, supporting use cases like this (when I say project I mean a waterfall-style activity):

# If project X is the highest priority and project Y is the second-highest, can we go live with any other projects at the next release date? Schedule them and fill up the rest of the capacity with longer projects and our ongoing enhancements Scrum. JPO plans that the first architect will work on project X, then will move to project Z. The other architect will work on project X as well, then a few epics, then project Y, then more epics.
# Oh no, project X task X.1.2 has slipped by two weeks! Reschedule everything, taking into account that task Y.2.4 cannot be shifted, since it is done by an external vendor. Now the architects don't have time to work on project Z, it slips into the next release, and architect 1 is scheduled to work on epics, while architect 2 moves to Y straight from X.
fields.summary: Cross-plan teams and scheduling.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-486].
  {panel}

Hi!
We created custom sprints for a team. Portfolio automatically assigned stories to sprints. But when the first sprint time was over, Portfolio didn't move stories to the next sprint and didn't signalized that we failed.
Could anybody explain why, please? What is the reason of using Portfolio if it doesn't signalize about such failure and doesn't move stories on and on.
http://prntscr.com/868iaj - printscreen
The same situation is with automatic sprints (sprint1 ... sprintN) http://prntscr.com/868mak
fields.summary: Stories aren't moved from sprint to sprint after one is finished

fields.description:
We found a bug where the (original) estimates of an epic/initiative are not correctly pushed towards the linked JIRA issue when the 'Apply updates to projects' tool is used.

I'll explain in a scenario:
1. configure your Portfolio plan to synchronise summary, description and estimates automatically for epics, initiatives and stories.
2. create a JIRA ticket and import it in JIRA portfolio as an initiative
3. create a JIRA ticket and import it in JIRA portfolio as an epic under the created initiative
4. create three JIRA tickets, give them each an estimate of 5 days and import it in JIRA portfolio as stories under the created epic
5. go to one of the three JIRA tickets that are linked and log 0.5 day of work
6. Select the 'Apply updates to projects' tool, select to update initiatives, epics and stories for estimates & Update.

After step 4, you will see that the JIRA ticket linked to the initiative will show an estimate of 15 days.
After step 6, you will see that the JIRA ticket linked to the initiative will show an estimate of 5 days.

This is wrong, it should still show 15 days instead of 5. Now it only shows the sum of the estimates for stories that have worklogs, which is not what you want as a project manager.
fields.summary: Apply updates to projects doesn't correctly update original estimates for epics and initiatives
Create and link existing issues should provide an immediate sync between JIRA and Portfolio

fields.description:
In case a plan is using _Story points_ as planning unit and _Estimates_ are synced back to JIRA along with _Summary_ and _Description_, changes to _Summary_ and _Description_ are not pushed from JIRA to Portfolio.

*Work-around:*
Untick the the _Estimates_ option in the plans sync settings in order to get _Summary_ and _Description_ changes from JIRA to Portfolio.
fields.summary: Summary and description not synced back from JIRA to Portfolio in certain setups
Allow for importing of assignee when importing issues from JIRA to Portfolio

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-476].
  {panel}

I would like to use a Portfolio plan to define a single set of Releases and be able to easily spread this information on a number of JIRA projects.

Today, we can import JIRA Versions to create Portfolio Releases or link Versions to Releases.
In a plan, backlog items are dispatched across these Releases, but we can only "apply" the release to a JIRA issue if a corresponding Version exists in corresponding JIRA project.

it would be good if the *"Apply updates to projects" could automatically create Versions* required, perhaps asking confirmation to the user, *whenever no existing version matches the release* (name, start/end) being applied.
fields.summary: Create JIRA Versions from Portfolio Releases with "apply updates to projects"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-475].
  {panel}

I would like to use a Portfolio plan to define a single set of Releases and be able to easily spread this information on a number of JIRA projects.

Today, we can import JIRA Versions to create Portfolio Releases or link Versions to Releases.
In a plan, backlog items are dispatched across these Releases, but we can only "apply" the release to a JIRA issue if a corresponding Version exists in corresponding JIRA project.

it would be good if the *"Apply updates to projects" could automatically create Versions* required, perhaps asking confirmation to the user, *whenever no existing version matches the release* (name, start/end) being applied. The advantage would be to save considerable time as one can avoid defining all the Versions in all my source JIRA projects
fields.summary: Create JIRA Versions from Portfolio Releases with "apply updates to projects"
When linking JIRA issues there is no warning of issues already linked
issue Key is not updated when issue changes project key

fields.description:
In a situation where a structured epic (i.e., one having child stories) and an unstructured work item (like a story or an epic without children) are linked to the same JIRA issue, the estimate suggestions in the _Update from date_ dialog are wrong. The children of the respective structure epic will end up receiving the overall  remaining estimate of the parent instead of the remaining estimates of the linked stories.

For instance, a situation like that:

||Portfolio work item||linked JIRA issue key||
|Epic 01|JIRA-01|
|  Child 1.01|JIRA-02|
|  Child 1.02|JIRA-03|
|Epic 02|JIRA-01|

This requires the plan to be use _Days_ or _Hours_ as planning unit, _Plan > Configure > Synchronization > Plan update > Update estimates_ to be turned on and a _time based_ progress configuration.
fields.summary: Replanning suggestions don't work correctly if structured epic and an unstructured item are linked to the same JIRA issue

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-470].
  {panel}

h2. Status quo

Suppliers export the file attached when they download an order from Conny. 
Although this file has a field called "Authority_to_leave" it is not filled. 
As a result, inappropriate delivery services are provided to customers. 

h2. Goal

Fill the "authority to leave" parameter with the order information in the file exported by suppliers.
fields.summary: Authority to leave missing in downloaded file from conny

Advanced description editing (Wiki markup for description)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-466].
  {panel}

*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Create a JPO Plan
# Tries to access the plan 

*Expected Results:*
The plan would load normally.

*Actual Results:*
A blank page shows up. On the web inspector we can see the following:
{code}Uncaught QuotaExceededError: Failed to execute 'setItem' on 'Storage': Setting the value of 'radiantminds.roadmap.plan-3.reports-releases.activeView' exceeded the quota.{code}

*Workaround:*
# Go to chrome://settings/cookies
# Search for the plan URL
# Find "local storage", click remove

*Notes:*
Browser: Chrome version 44.0.2403.130 (64-bit)
Similar case: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-32634

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-452].
  {panel}

h3. *Summary*
Users shouldn't be shown inactive/disabled users when adding team members or resource allocations. 
Might want to also check any other spots where inactive users can be selected.

*Expected Result:*
Only active users are in the drop down list

*Current Result:*
All users, including inactive users are listed in the drop down list.

*Workaround:*
*For Portfolio Cloud:*
Revoke *Application Access* for inactive users and this should make sure that they are no longer in the drop down list for users. (!)_This workaround does not work in JIRA Cloud {{7.0.0-OD-02}}_
fields.summary: Inactive users selectable for Teams and Resources

fields.summary: Jira Portfolio can not enabled

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-450].
  {panel}

Within JIRA Portfolio Epics can be associated with an Initiative.

You can also create JIRA issues linked to the Initiatives within Portfolio.

The Epics in Portfolio can also be associated with JIRA issues of type Epic.

When you link a JIRA issue with an Initiative this should create a link between the Issue and the Epic JIRA issues which implement that Initiative.

For example

* Initiative = Mars Mission (JIRA issue SPACE-100) -- is implemented by
** Epic = Space Craft Build (JIRA issue SPACE-200)
** Epic = Catering (JIRA issue SPACE-250)
 
If you open up issue SPACE-100 you would see an issue link pointing at SPACE-200 and SPACE-250 and the corresponding counter-links would appear on those issues as well.

This will increase the traceability and visibility of the Initiatives and also allow JQL queries to be constructed which can then be used in regular JIRA issue navigator based reporting. For example -- something like:

{noformat}
issuetype = Initiative AND summary = "Mars Mission" AND status NOT IN (Resolved, Closed) AND NOT (issueFunction IN linkedIssuesOf("status != Closed", "implements")
{noformat}

Would show you all of the outstanding Epics required to implement the Mars Mission initiative.
fields.summary: JIRA issues associated with Initiatives should link to the implementing Epics

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-449].
  {panel}

Using the Recalculate functionality will add a story to the most recent closed sprint in addition to the next available sprint. 

Steps: 
* Ensure you have a closed sprint and a new future sprint (i.e. sprint 1, Jul 1 - Jul 15; sprint 2, Jul 16 - Jul 31)
* Add a story, fixversion, estimate in Backlog view
* Click on 'Recalculate'
* Bug: Story has been assigned sprint 1 and sprint 2
fields.summary: Story added to closed sprint when using 'Recalculate'
JIRA Portfolio "Apply updates to project/s" should never overwrite fields with blank values.
Jira portfolio Start and end dates value availability in JQL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-446].
  {panel}

When setting Portfolio Permissions, the "JIRA Portfolio Restricted User" indicates:
{quote}users with this role are not permitted to update issues in JIRA projects from within JIRA Portfolio.
{quote}
What this does is restrict the ability for an user to [publish updates from Portfolio back to JIRA's projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolioServer/Publish+Updates+to+Linked+Projects], but a [synchronisation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAPortfolioServer/Synchronization+Settings] will still occur.

This may cause confusion to users that expect JIRA Portfolio to not affect JIRA's issues.
h5. Workaround

Disable automatic synchronisation
 * go to _Plan > Configure > Synchronization > Keep backlog items in sync_
 * uncheck all the checkboxes.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-437].
  {panel}

I understand why the numbered priority of 1,2,3,N exists but sometimes (many times) it doesn't matter, and I'd rather say that all of these epics are equally important and I'd rather you optimize only for any dependencies that exist. But I realize that may not be the way that everyone works or thinks.

So here's my thought: add an option under the settings called something like this:

*Prioritization Constraint*
* *On* - The current Portfolio Operation for Epics and Stories
* *Off* - Makes Epics and Stories behave like Initiatives by having no priority
* *Mixed* - Allows for the priority column to have items that have no priority together at the bottom and also set priority numbers for items
fields.summary: Toggle Prioritizing Epics and Stories
Error Message when creating a team

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-435].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, when you perform a wrong move of  *update from date* or *Apply updates to projects* you have no chance to retrieve your previous state.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a reset button or similar functionality to revert to previous state/changes

h3. Workaround 
Update from date : You can just set the *update from date* date to the past if you did something wrong.
Apply updates to projects : Need to restore your JIRA back prior to the changes
fields.summary: reset "update from date" and "Apply updates to projects" to previous state/changes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Portfolio Server*. Using *JIRA Portfolio Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JPOCLOUD-434].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, if there are  hundred of User Stories it would be good if we can keep track the history of what happens between the release or any changes which the story has went through.

*Example:*
# When the stories (epics) were completed 
# When stories were descoped (move to another releases).

h3. Suggested Solution
Perhaps there could be some data being recorded in a reporting form whereby all these changes are being tracked.
fields.summary: history of release changes

fields.summary: Exception on portfolio recalculation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When an issue is linked from JIRA Portfolio, editing the estimate will make unexpected changes to the linked issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Go to the (project portfolio) Backlog tab.
# Add new Epic by clicking "Create Epic". Only enter the title.
# Link the Epic with an existing epic issue - the column may need to be added.
# Add an estimate value.
# View the issue.

Additionally using 'Update from date...' can cause this to occur.

h3. Expected Results

The field is not erased.

h3. Actual Results

The description field is cleared out.

h3. Workaround

This can be worked around by turning off auto-synchronization for the description (and if required also for the title) under *Plan > Configure > Synchronization*.
fields.summary: Linking a Epic from the JIRA Portfolio backlog overwrites the description
Allow fixing sprints and multi-selecting them
Allow fixing of Start Date
